result.execSummary:
The defendant Courtney L Persons was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Conceal (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(d).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Waukesha County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: With Huber. Sentence credit of 2 days were granted if imposed.
May be transferred to Milwaukee County.

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.

No Contact with Brookfield Square Mall or with any Boston Store. 
Attend the Retail Theft class at UWM.
Follow through with any treatment or counseling recommended by agent. 
  Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes: To be completed as directed by agent.

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Courtney L Persons in court with Attorney J Anthony Rosario.  Bryan C. Bayer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State files an amended information.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count #1 on amended information.  Court performs plea colloquy and finds Defendant guilty of Count #1 on amended information.  State gives sentencing recommendations.  Attorney Rosario makes statements regarding sentencing.  Defendant makes statements.  Court sentences the Defendant to the following:

COUNT #1:  IMPOSED AND STAYED SENTENCE OF:   

150 DAYS HUBER (CREDIT - 2 days)

TERM OF PROBATION:  1 YEAR    *Transfer allowed to Milwaukee County*

CONDITIONS OF PROBATON:  
____Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
____No contact with: Brookfield Square Mall or with any Boston Store
____Retail theft class at UWM
____25 Hours of Community Service

**Defendant to provide DNA sample, immediately if in custody or within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff's Department**  

COSTS:  $253.00 & $200.00 DNA surcharge (to be paid as a condition of probation)

Prior: 7223 W. Silver Spring Drive #3, Milwaukee, WI 53218
Notice of Hearing returned, for hearing scheduled on: 10/02/15.

Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing.
